thread.title: Celtic's Moussa Dembele's Agent Discusses Player's Future
thread.title_full: Celtic's Moussa Dembele's Agent Discusses Player's Future

title: Celtic's Moussa Dembele's Agent Discusses Player's Future
text:
Celtic's Moussa Dembele's Agent Discusses Player's Future Wed Feb 22 2017 18:10:45   18:10:45 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
Moussa Dembele has long been linked with a big future and his present is full of goals too. He's a wanted man and his agent has been discussing his future. 
Dembele came to everyone's attention during his spell with Fulham and his contract was coming to a finish at the end of last season. 
At that point he was linked with some big clubs with Tottenham Hotspur adding to the Moussa Dembele's in their squad seeming like the most likely option but he ended up going to Celtic instead. 
Watch our fan footage of Celtic's infamous support: 
The 20 year old is having a right old time in Scotland and has so far bagged himself 24 goals in all competitions including seven in the last three which itself has included back-to-back hat-tricks. 
That will make him a wanted man once again this summer but, as reported by the Sun , his agent Mamadi Fofana said about his client's future: 
"Moussa doesn't stress. He signed a four-year deal at Celtic and, in his head, he'll be at Celtic for those four years. 
"If he has to leave, that will happen at the right time, but it's not in Moussa's head nor my head. In January, there was speculation, but there will always be speculation if he does well." 
And Fofana is right about their being speculation back in January. 
On transfer deadline day the young French forward was heavily linked with a Â£40 million bid from Chelsea, helped by images of the player in London. 
However it transpired that he was there for medical reasons and the Blues rejected claims that they'd made a bid for the striker. 
On Dembele's future at Celtic Park his representative added, "We are there for the boy to become a better player , for the club to achieve more things and the club wants to keep their best players." 
He's certainly likely to achieve at least one league winners medal this year and who knows what else in the future. 
Europe's elite will have to wait! Sponsored Links
